page.title: 16VISITING A SENIOR CITIZEN
page.content: Mrs. McLean lives in a sheltered house. She is 78 years old and has always lived in{Thurso.}She likes to be called{Jinad}which is Caithness dialect for Janet and for many years wrote articles and poems for the local newspaper using this name. She has a great interest in old things and looked after the Local Folk Museum for many years. Jinad loved school but told us that there were many barefooted children then. School was heated by a small fire which didn't give them much heat as the teacher stood in front of it. A home she had to bring in 10 buckets of water a day. They ate porridge and milk, tatties and herring and on Sunday mince and tatties. When{Jinad}left school she gutted fish for 35 shillings a week and worked from 7a.m. until 11p.m.
